i need help unlocking a folder: chmod and chown are good friends to have
they are included in your install.. chmod changes permissions on files and folders
chown changes ownership of files and folders
where is this folder you need to unlock?
hm.. updating pb?... ok, run this command "sudo chmod a+rw -R ~/.etwolf"
a+rw means give all users read and write rights.. -R means recursive.. sudo is probably not needed but you never know
